channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Got Lax on Credit Cards. The Bill Is Coming Due.
item.description: The bank lent loosely on some credit cards, contributing to a big loss as it tries to sell the General Motors card business.

item.title: Airbus CEO upbeat on new engine technology, but jury still out
Fed Backpedals on Plan to Increase Big Bank Capital
item.description: Banks spent over a year fighting earlier proposals that would have raised some banksâ€™ capital buffers by nearly 20%.

item.title: US bill to restrict business with China's WuXi AppTec, BGI passes House
An Ugly Picture Emerges for Cosmetics Makers in China
item.description: Sales are plunging, sending an economic warning signal in what was once their most important market.

item.title: FTC tells Seven & i it intends to probe potential Couche-Tard deal, source says
It's the Airplane of the Future. It's Still Grounded.
item.description: Engine problems are the latest chapter in the troubled history of the Airbus A220, a jet that has the potential to revolutionize regional and short-ha...

item.title: How a Japanese suitor misread politics with U.S. Steel bid, despite warning signs
The Shadow Dollar That's Fueling the Financial Underworld
item.description: The cryptocurrency tether enables a parallel economy that operates beyond the reach of U.S. law enforcement.

item.title: Eli Lilly reports weekly insulin efsitora meets trial goal
